simpplle.gui

Class WildlifeSelectSpecies

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Dialog
            • javax.swing.JDialog
              • simpplle.gui.WildlifeSelectSpecies
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class WildlifeSelectSpecies
extends javax.swing.JDialog
    The University of Montana owns copyright of the designated documentation contained within this file as part of the software product designated by Uniform Resource Identifier UM-OpenSIMPPLLE-1.0. By copying this file the user accepts the University of Montana Open Source License Contract pertaining to this documentation and agrees to abide by all restrictions, requirements, and assertions contained therein. All Other Rights Reserved.

    This class sets up Wildlife Select Species, a type of JDialog. This class sets up a dialog to choose individual mammals, birds, amphibians, or reptiles. It gives user the choice of a report for entire group or individuals members of it.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • WildlifeSelectSpecies

        public WildlifeSelectSpecies(java.awt.Frame frame,
                     java.lang.String title,
                     boolean modal,
                     int group)
        Constructor for Wildlife Selector Gui. This is called from the Wildlife Habitat dialog
        Parameters:
        frame -
        title - if passed in will be "Wildlife Habitat Interpretations"
        modal -
        group - choices are mammals, birds, amphibians, or reptiles

      • WildlifeSelectSpecies

        public WildlifeSelectSpecies()
        Overloaded constructor for wildlife selector. This one sets the owner to null, title to empty string, modality to false. This constructor sets the species group to mammals by default.

        Parameters:
        speciesName - name of species i.e "Black-footed Ferret"
        maxSpeciesLength - how many species in a group
